Setup wave Gender Age Weight Goal Finish (in years) (in Kg) Male Icon Female Icon Aryan Raj Select Goal Muscle Gain Fat Loss Maintain Muscle Get Started Muscle Gain Fat Loss Muscle Maintain Select Your Exercise Chest Workout Day: Monday 01:00 HRS Chest Muscle Go Back Workout day: Tuesday day: Wednesday day: Thursday day: Friday day: Saturday SHOULDER workout Arms workout Leg workout ABS workout Push Up Dumbbell Bench Press 12 rep x 3 sets Incline Dumbbell Bench Press Dumbbell Flyes Chest Dips 10 rep x 3 sets Decline Dumbbell Bench Press How to do this
Position: Start in a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
 Alignment: Ensure your body forms a straight line from head to heels, engaging your core muscles.
 Descent: Lower your chest toward the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
 Push: Push back up to the starting position by straightening your arms. Keep your body in a straight line throughout.
 Repeat: Perform the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form.
Setup: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand.Place the dumbbells on your knees. Carefully lie back on the bench, keeping the dumbbells close to your chest.
 Grip:Hold one dumbbell in each hand.Position the dumbbells at shoulder width, with your palms facing forward.
 Positioning:Press the dumbbells up above your chest.Keep your feet flat on the ground and your back on the bench.Maintain a slight arch in your lower back.
 Descent:Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides of your chest.Keep your elbows at a 90-degree angle, creating a right angle with your upper arms parallel to the ground.
 Ascent:Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position.Fully extend your arms without locking your elbows.
 Breathing:Inhale as you lower the dumbbells.Exhale as you push them back up.
Setup: Adjust an incline bench to about a 30-45 degree angle. Sit on the bench with your back firmly against the padding, feet flat on the floor.
 Grip:Pick up a dumbbell in each hand. Start with a weight that allows you to maintain proper form.
 Positioning:With the dumbbells in hand, lie back on the bench. Hold the dumbbells at shoulder level with your palms facing away from you. Your elbows should be bent and aligned with your shoulders.
 Descent:Exhale as you push the dumbbells upward, extending your arms fully but without locking your elbows. Keep your wrists firm and the weights stable throughout the movement.
 Ascent:Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position.Fully extend your arms without locking your elbows.
 Breathing:Inhale as you lower the dumbbells.Exhale as you push them back up.
Setup: Adjust the decline bench to the desired angle (usually around 30-45 degrees). 
 Grip:Sit at the end of the bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Start with a weight that allows you to maintain proper form.
 Positioning:Carefully lie back on the bench, keeping your feet secured in the leg pads. Position the dumbbells above your chest, arms extended, palms facing forward.
 Descent:Lower the dumbbells slowly and with control, allowing your elbows to bend. Keep your upper arms at about a 45-degree angle to your body.
 Ascent:Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully without locking your elbows.
 Breathing:Inhale as you lower the dumbbells.Exhale as you push them back up.
Setup: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand. 
 Grip:Extend your arms above your chest, palms facing each other. Bend your elbows slightly to maintain a soft lock in your arms.
 Positioning:Keep a slight bend in your elbows and slowly open your arms in a wide arc motion, lowering the dumbbells out to the sides until you feel a stretch in your chest.
 Descent:Lower the dumbbells slowly and with control, allowing your elbows to bend. Keep your upper arms at about a 45-degree angle to your body.
 Ascent:Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully without locking your elbows.
 Breathing:Inhale as you lower the dumbbells.Exhale as you push them back up.
Find a Dip Station:Locate parallel bars or a dip station that is sturdy and secure.
 Starting Position:Stand between the bars and grab each bar with your palms facing inward.Lift yourself up so your arms are fully extended.
 Lowering Phase:Lower your body by bending your elbows while leaning slightly forward.
 Pushing Phase:Push through your palms and straighten your arms to lift your body back up to the starting position.

Shoulder Day Pike PushUp Dumbbell Shoulder Press Lateral Raise Front Raises Reverse Flyes BodyWeight Shoulder Tap ReverseFlyes

Body Tap
Setup:Start in a plank position with your hands beneath your shoulders.
 Execution:Lift your hips, bringing your body into an inverted V shape.Lower your head towards the ground by bending your elbows.Push back up to the starting position.Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Setup: Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
 Execution:Press the dumbbells overhead, extending your arms fully.Keep your core engaged and maintain a neutral spine.Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height in a controlled manner.Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Squats Lunges Dumbbell Row Mountain Climber Dumbbell Deadlifts Burpess Plank with Dumbbell Row Jump Squats Russian Twist Dumbbell Thrusters PULL UPs SUPERMAN EXERCISE DUMBBELL PULLOVER RENEGADE ROWS BICEP CURL TRICEP DIPS OVERHEAD PRESS HAMMER CURL PLANK ARM RAISES 20 rep x 3 sets GLUTE BRIDGES CALF RAISES LEG RAISES SIT UPs BIKE CRUNCHES
//Back Tutorial
STEP 1:Begin hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip. The body should be in a straight line from head-to-toe with the spine and hips in neutral and the legs straight. You may cross the legs, if desired.
 STEP 2:Draw your shoulder blades down away from your ears to engage the lats first.
 STEP 3:Now pull your entire body straight up toward the ceiling until your chin is above the bar. The arms will bend as you draw your elbows down toward your rib cage on either side.
 STEP 4:Then, slowly lower your body back down to a dead hang as you straighten the arms overhead.
 STEP 5:Repeat for the desired repetitions.

STEP 1:Begin standing with the feet hip distance apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
 STEP 2:Hinge the torso forward to 45-degrees with the arms straight and a slight bend in the knees.
 STEP 3:Row the dumbbells back and up as you squeeze the shoulder blades together.
 STEP 4:Pause for a moment at the top before lowering the dumbbells back down to the start position.
 STEP 5:Repeat for the desired repetitions.

STEP 1:Begin lying face down with the legs hip distance apart and arms straight overhead by your ears holding one dumbbell. Have your forehead down into the ground.
 STEP 2:Raise your arms, dumbbell, thighs, and forehead up off the ground a couple inches and pause. Be sure to pull the abs up toward the spine and keep your gaze down at the ground.
 STEP 3:Lower the entire body down.
 STEP 4:Repeat for the desired repetitions.

Setup:Lie down on a flat bench with only your upper back and shoulders on the bench. Your feet should be planted firmly on the ground, and your hips should be slightly lower than your shoulders.
 Positioning:Lower the dumbbell backward over your head in a semi-circular motion while keeping a slight bend in your elbows. Your arms should be slightly angled backward, not directly perpendicular to your body.
 Stretch:Lower the dumbbell as far as comfortably possible without allowing your lower back to arch excessively or losing control. You should feel a stretch in your chest and lats.
 Return:Slowly reverse the movement, bringing the dumbbell back to the starting position using the same semi-circular motion.
 Repeat:Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control and a steady pace throughout the exercise.
STEP 1:Begin holding a kettlebell in each hand and assume a high plank position on them. The kettlebells/hands should be directly under the shoulders. Feet should be hip distance apart with the legs straight. Engage your abs to maintain a neutral spine.
 STEP 2:While keeping your entire body still and in a straight line, row one elbow up and back momentarily.
 STEP 3:Then lower that kettlebell back down to the plank position.
 STEP 4:Repeat the row on the other arm.
 STEP 5:Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Setup:Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward (a pronated grip).
 Positioning:Hinge at your hips to bend forward, keeping your back straight and chest up. Your torso should be almost parallel to the ground. Arms should hang directly below your shoulders.
 Hold and Squeeze:Hold the top position for a moment, emphasizing the contraction in your upper back muscles. Lower and Repeat:Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner to the starting position.
STEP 1:Begin standing while holding a dumbbell in each hand at your side. Have the shoulders down and back with a tall posture.
 STEP 2:Raise one arm up and out to the side to shoulder height with the palm facing down.
 STEP 3:Lower that arm down.
 STEP 4:Repeat on the other arm.
 STEP 5:Continue alternating left and right arms.
STEP 1:Begin standing with the feet hip distance apart. Hold a dumbbell in each hand you’re your thighs with a pronated grip (palms facing behind you) and the arms straight.
 STEP 2:While keeping the shoulder blades down and back, raise the dumbbells up to chest height with the palms facing down.
 STEP 3:Then, lower the arms back down toward your thighs with control
 STEP 4:Repeat for the desired repetitions.

Starting Position:Begin in a high plank position, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core muscles to maintain stability.
 Tap Alternate Shoulders:Lift your right hand off the ground and touch your left shoulder. Keep your hips square and minimize any twisting or swaying motion in your body.
 Return to Plank:Place your right hand back on the ground in its original position, returning to the high plank.
 Repeat on the Other Side:Lift your left hand off the ground and touch your right shoulder.

MIND BODY FITNESS logo Hello There.. LOG OUT App logo
STEP 1:Begin standing with the feet out wide, toes turned out, and your hands on your hips.
 STEP 2:Lower the hips down and back as you squat down until your hips are below your knees. Be sure to push both knees outward away from each other.
 STEP 3:Once you feel a deep inner thigh stretch, reverse the motion as you stand back upright straightening both legs completely.
 STEP 4:Repeat for the desired repetitions.

STEP 1:Begin standing with the feet together and your hands on your hips.
 STEP 2:With one foot, take a large step forward as you lunge down bringing the back knee down toward the ground.
 STEP 3:Once the back knee is about an inch off the ground, reverse the motion as you shift your weight toward the back leg and stand back upright with the feet together again.
 STEP 4:Repeat for the desired repetitions.

STEP 1:Begin in a high plank position on your hands and feet with the hands directly under the shoulders. Be on your toes with the feet hip distance apart. Have your spine in a straight line from head-to-toe.
 STEP 2:Lift one foot off the ground as you bend that knee and crunch the knee toward your chest.
 STEP 3:Straighten that leg to place that foot back on the ground as you crunch the other knee in toward your chest in a quick manner.
 STEP 4:Repeat for the desired repetitions, alternating legs.

STEP 1:Begin standing with the dumbbells placed between your feet. Have the feet about hip distance apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with the arms straight.
 STEP 2:Assume a hinge position as you push the hips back, bend the knees slightly, and engage your abdominals to keep a neutral spine.
 STEP 3:Pull the shoulder blades down and back to engage the lats.
 STEP 4:Then, straighten the legs as you raise the dumbbells straight up off the ground while keeping them close to your shins and thighs.
